questions.text:
"Black dress with the tights underneath.  I've got the breath of a last cigarette on my teeth."

These are the first few lines of one of 3OH!3's most popular songs.  What is it?
questions.explanation:
Don't Trust Me.

	"Don't Trust Me" was released as a single in 2009, and was re-released in the UK in 2010.  It can be found on their 2008 album "Want".

questions.text:
"L-O-V-E's just another word I'll never learn to pronounce."

This song never mentions the title anywhere in the lyrics.  Which song is it?
questions.explanation:
Starstrukk.

	"Starstrukk" was released as a single in late 2009, over a year after the release of the album it is found on, "Want".  The song was also remade with Katy Perry.

questions.text:
"When they see them glimmerin' they buy 'em."

Which song contains these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Photofinnish.

	"Photofinnish" was released in 2008 on the album "Want".  In the song, 3OH!3 sings the title, "Photofinnish", a dozen (12) times.

questions.text:
"Trainwreck that I am and I am what I am what I am a trainwreck."

Though the song begins peaceful, it ends sort of obnoxious.  Which song is this?
questions.explanation:
Colorado Sunrise.

	"Colorado Sunrise" was released in 3OH!3's 2008 album "Want".  The band was formed in Colorado, which is why they wrote a song called "Colorado Sunrise".

questions.text:
"Lips like licorice, tongue like candy."

This is a very odd song about someone's something special.  What song is it?
questions.explanation:
My First Kiss.

	"My First Kiss" was 3OH!3's first single on their third studio album, "Streets of Gold".  The song was partially written by Ke$ha, though she was not credited.  However, she was featured in the song with them.

questions.text:
"She stopped me in the doorway.  She kissed me on the lips."

Which 3OH!3 song is the verse above from?
questions.explanation:
See You Go.

	"See You Go" was released in 2010 on 3OH!3's album "Streets of Gold".  The song is about someone not wanting to be "the guy to see you go".

questions.text:
"You can keep the necklace that I gave you to.  I'll keep the tattoos."

Which somewhat sad 3OH!3 song contains the above lyrics?
questions.explanation:
R.I.P.

	"R.I.P." was released on 3OH!3's third album, "Streets of Gold" (2010).  The song is a break-up song ("R.I.P. you and me").

questions.text:
"Hey Mr. Bartender mix me a drink.  I really need something to tell me it's okay not to think."

These are the opening lines of which song by 3OH!3?
questions.explanation:
Deja Vu.

	"Deja Vu" was the second single from 3OH!3's third album.  The album was "Streets of Gold", and both the album and the single were released in 2010.

questions.text:
"Zip your lips like a padlock."

3OH!3 is featured in a Ke$ha song.  Which one?
questions.explanation:
Blah Blah Blah.

	Ke$ha released her album "Animal" on the first day of 2010.  One of her singles from that album, released later the same year, was "Blah Blah Blah".  3OH!3 is featured in that song.

questions.text:
"Drinks up high every time I hit the party."

This is the first line to a Lil Jon song that features 3OH!3.  Which one is it?
questions.explanation:
Hey.

	"Hey" was released as a single in 2010, and can be found on Lil Jon's 2010 album "Crunk Rock."  3OH!3 collaborated with Lil Jon on the song.
